body.name: A Vexing Valentine: A standalone holiday monster romance novella (Monsters of The Divide Book 2)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This one was so cute. Vex is such an adorable yet terrifying monster. And Max is such a lovable bear of a man. I can't wait for the next one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Can’t Wait for More!
reviews.reviewText: I truly enjoyed this! I read Paine for the Holidays earlier this month, and wasn’t sure how I’d like a Valentine’s Day theme but it was great! There was depth with the characters and the emotions all felt genuine. I can’t wait for the next two books!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: What an adorable monster mate. They and their human made the perfect couple. I am looking forward to learning more about Malicious.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars a really good, spicy, mlm v’day read
reviews.reviewText: This book was a really fun, spicy, quick read for Valentine’s Day. It was what I needed and I enjoyed both characters very much. The internal monologue felt a little repetitive at times, but that’s easy to ignore because there was a lot of world-building in this tiny novella. I liked all the concepts and felt like it was very well-thought out and complex. Overall, really liked it and I will be getting a physical copy for my trophy shelf as soon as I can!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just as good as the first
reviews.reviewText: I loved getting to see vex again. What a sad past max had. I'm glad they found each other. I can't wait to read malicious' story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: ✨ A Vexing Valentine by T.B. Wiese ✨Happy Release T.B. Wiese on your newest release. I have been reading her work from Forsaken By The Gods series and now this paranormal romance and I enjoyed it so much. I do got to say when I started reading this one I didnt know what I was jumping into and it turned out that this is my first ever non-binary read. I have read plenty of MM and poly romance but this is my first ever non-binary character which I was pleasantly surprise. I will have to say it was a bit of a challange but that is just due to the fact that English is not my first language so reworking my brain when it came to the pronouns when it came to reading was a small hiccup at the begining. Once I was able to get that situated, I devoured the story so fast and it was nice to see the apperance of Paine from Paine for the Holidays which is the first novella in the series.If you love💫 Holiday Paranormal Romance💫 Enemies to Lovers💫 He's a monter hunter / They are a monster💫 MM (Male & NonBinary RomanceType: Paranormal RomanceRating: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Spice: 🌶️🌶️Stand Alone or Series: Standalone Novella (Monsters of the Divide)TWs: Violance, 🩸 , Gore Use of 🔫s /🔪s, Bitting, Claiming, Loss of a love one💋naj_ana_reads💋Mood Reader

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great read!!
reviews.reviewText: I loved this book! Its very fast paced! I loved how vex did not give up on max! And it took max a bit long but he fell hard for vex!! Can't wait to read more!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect mix and of spice and cuteness!
reviews.reviewText: Picked up this book on whim and I’m so happy I did. First the author send the cutest package white art and swag.Digging into the story wasn’t sure what to expect…certainly not a monster with a heart or a monster realm that reflected the human world.Vex is anything but vexing and makes me wish I had my own monster waiting in the shadows. Max definitely has lots of shadows that haunt him and the way vex chases them away is beautiful and will make your heart melt.Don’t think that it all sweet there is definitely slice added in the mix and clues to a much bigger plot unfolding that I suspect will unfold across the different books of Monsters if the Divide

reviews.reviewTitle: Just as good as the first one
reviews.reviewText: I loved this monster/human holiday novella!!
